it will be good to have this because MVC generates a "cache-buster" with each build so the client doesn't cache old vesions of js or css

minification seems to be working now. key was on local controllers, such as var controller = function(..), you have to set the injection string params, like var controller = ['...', function(...){}]
I talked to Jim just now and got clarification on the spawn-remidner when patient added. I'll work on that rest of day. I'm WAH rest of day. Walking home so offline for 1/2 hour
right, I'm just saying that for now one could just run the reset-db part, then do the rest by signing up through the ui. either way's fine it seems

the script for the db reset is nice
but the scripts are important too - for future automation work
easier to just do signup from the ui. easy enough to explain to someone new to the team
but it's a start
well it's funky in that you have to stop the API to do a db reset, and then start it back up to continue with the rest of the script
I like scripts. thank you. I find onboard scripts easier for introducing new devs to the team. they won't need to know the app
sure, would be good for ryan to pick up
maybe it's something Ryan and/or Keith can use as a starting point
thx

anyway, I'm going to deploy the unminified version for Keith first

ok
ok

Also :grinning: note that on Reminders the time component is lost in the UI. This is not due to any time conversion issue but b/c on the server we currently truncate the time component on a reminder due date. We're not supporting times in Reminders now so that shouldnt be an issue for beta. In the future when we support reminder times it will be. At that point we'll have to address some subtlties in LInQ with EF that caused me to truncate the time component with reminders...
np
thanks for digging through this.
ok

footnote to this - I found that the angular date filter does not interpret the date/times from the server as UTC. sigh... Also by experimenting on jsfiddle I saw that earlier versions of angular *did* interpret it as UTC. Current official angular documenation says that sans Z or time zone info it will be interpreted as local. So I will keep the utcToLocal filter around. Remember to use it as a filter preceding the angular Date filter when displaying date/times from our server code
